alert.note: Alert for Mayes (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 04 at 12:59PM CDT until May 04 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Arkansas and Oklahoma, including the following counties, in northwest Arkansas, Benton and Washington AR. In Oklahoma, Adair, Cherokee, Delaware and Mayes. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1258 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen, with locally 3 inches in a few areas. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fayetteville... Springdale... Rogers... Bentonville... Siloam Springs... Jay... Pryor... Bella Vista... Pryor Creek... Lowell... Farmington... Pea Ridge... Gentry... Tontitown... Gravette... Cave Springs... Decatur... Westville... Locust Grove... Salina... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
